params.name: providerId
params.doc: ID of the external calendar provider. Find this with the [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) function.

params.name: scheduleId
params.doc: ID of the schedule to connect with the external calendar account.

params.name: email
params.doc: Email address for the external calendar account.

params.name: password
params.doc: Password for the external calendar account.

docs.summary: Connects to an external calendar by directly providing the external calendar account credentials.
description:
Once a connection is successfully created, use [`listEvents()`](#list-events) to obtain an up-to-date list of events in the connected external calendars.

> **Note:**
> Use [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) to find out whether to connect to a particular provider using this method or [`connectByOAuth()`](#connect-by-o-auth).

examples.title: Connect with an external calendar by credentials
body: async function connectByCredentials(providerId, scheduleId, email, password) {

params.name: providerId
params.doc: ID of the external calendar provider. Find this with the [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) function.

params.name: scheduleId
params.doc: ID of the schedule to connect with the external calendar account.

params.name: redirectUrl
params.doc:
URL to redirect the user to after they authorize access to the external calendar account.

If the connection is successfully established, the user is redirected to this URL with a query parameter `connectionId` containing the new connection ID.
If the attempt to connect fails, the user is redirected to this URL with a query parameter `error` containing the error type.

docs.summary: Connects to an external calendar using the OAuth authorization protocol.
description:
The authorization flow should take place as follows:

1. Call the function with the appropriate parameters.
2. Redirect the user to the URL received in the response.
3. The user authorizes access.
4. The user is redirected to the URL you provide in the `redirectUrl` parameter, with a query parameter `connectionId` containing the new connection ID.

If the attempt to connect fails, the user is still redirected to the URL you provide in the `redirectUrl` parameter,
but with a query parameter `error` containing one of the following values:

- `reject`: The user rejected the authorization request.
- `unsupported`: Connecting to the user's external account type is not supported by the provider.
- `internal`: An error unrelated to the client or the request that prevents the server from fulfilling the request.

Once a connection is successfully created, use [`listEvents()`](#list-events) to obtain an up-to-date list of events in the connected external calendars.

> **Note:**
> Use [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) to find out whether to connect to a particular provider using this endpoint or [`connectByCredentials()`](#connect-by-credentials).

examples.title: Connect with an external calendar by OAuth

params.name: connectionId
params.doc: ID of the external calendar connection to disconnect.

description:
When an external calendar is disconnected, the external calendar connection's `status` is changed to `DISCONNECTED`.

After disconnecting, [`listEvents()`](#list-events) no longer returns events from the disconnected external calendar.
Exported Wix calendar sessions are deleted from the external calendar.

params.name: connectionId
params.doc: ID of the connection to retrieve.

docs.summary: Retrieves an external calendar connection by ID.
description:
The external calendar connection contains details of the connection between a Wix site's calendar and calendars hosted by an external provider.

The `syncConfig` property contains configuration details for importing events from an external calendar, exporting events to an external calendar, or both.

examples.title: Get an external calendar connection by ID

params.name: connectionId
params.doc: ID of the external calendar connection to list calendars for.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of calendars belonging to the connected external calendar account.
description:
> **Note:**
> Before using this function, establish a connection with an external calendar using [`connectByCredentials()`](#connect-by-credentials) or [`connectByOAuth()`](#connect-by-o-auth).

examples.title: List calendars belonging to an external calendar account

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of external calendar connections.
description:
Each external calendar connections contain details of a connection between a Wix site's calendar and calendars hosted by an external provider.

The `syncConfig` property of each connection contains configuration details for importing events from an external calendar, exporting events to an external calendar, or both.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of events from all connected external calendars, based on the provided filtering and paging.
description:
Use List Events to retrieve an aggregated list of events in the connected external calendars for a specified time range, sorted by start date.

> **Note:**
> Before using this function, establish a connection with an external calendar using [`connectByCredentials()`](#connect-by-credentials) or [`connectByOAuth()`](#connect-by-o-auth).

examples.title: List all events within a time range
List events connected to a specified schedule

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of the external calendar providers for which the site supports integration.
description:
The list of external calendar providers includes:

+ External calendar providers that are supported by default, such as Google, Apple, and Microsoft.
+ External calenders for which the site owner has enabled integration by installing an app.

For each external calendar provider, the list contains information about supported connection methods and features.
For each provider, check `features.connectMethods` to find out whether to use [`connectByCredentials()`](#connect-by-credentials) or [`connectByOAuth()`](#connect-by-o-auth) to establish a connection.

examples.title: List the supported external calendar providers

params.name: connectionId
params.doc: ID of the external calendar connection to update.

docs.summary: Updates the specified external calendar connection's sync configuration.
description:
Use Update Sync Config to update a connection's `syncConfig` property.
The `syncConfig` property contains settings for enabling, configuring, or disabling functionality, including:

+ Importing events from one or more specified calendars in the connected external calendar account. If this is enabled, use [`listEvents()`](#list-events) to retrieve a list of events from the external calendar.
+ Exporting events from the Wix site's calendar to an external calendar.

To see an external calendar connection's existing sync configuration, use [`getConnection()`](#get-connection) or [`listConnections()`](#list-connections) and see the `syncConfig` property.

> **Note:**
> Supported functionality depends on the provider. Use [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) to see details about providers' supported features.

examples.title: Update connection to list events from specific external account calendars
Update connection to sync events to a new dedicated external account calendar

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country code.

members.name: countryFullname
members.doc: Country full name.

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the full address of this location.

members.name: geocode
members.doc: Coordinates of the physical address.

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text to help find the address.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Zip/postal code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Subdivision. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: subdivisions
members.doc: Multi-level subdivisions from top to bottom.

description: Physical address

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Address latitude.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Address longitude.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: constraints
members.doc: Constraints for calculating the schedule's availability.

members.name: end
members.doc: Date and time the schedule stops being available for booking. No value indicates no end time.

members.name: linkedSchedules
members.doc: Other schedules that impact the availability calculation. Relevant only when there are availability constraints.

members.name: start
members.doc: Date and time the schedule starts to be available for booking.

description:
<!-- Needs updating when recurrence has been tested
Schedule's availability calculation is executed by the schedule's available intervals and this additional information.
Schedule's available intervals are recurring intervals (defined in the schedule) minus sessions that has no more spots for bookings (including time between_slots), or schedule's sessions with open spots for bookings.-->

members.name: slotDurations
members.doc:
A list of duration options for slots, in minutes. Minimum value for a duration is 1.
The availability calculation generates slots with these durations, where there is no conflict with existing sessions or other availability constraints.

members.name: slotsSplitInterval
members.doc: An object defining the time between available slots' start times.  For example, a slot with slots_split_interval=5 can start every 5 minutes. The default is the slot duration.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc:
Specify how to split the slots in intervals of minutes.
This value indicates the time between available slots' start time. e.g., from 5 minute slots (3:00, 3:05, 3:15) and 1 hour slots (3:00, 4:00, 5:00).
Optional. The default is the first duration in slot_durations field.
Deprecated. Use the `split_slots_interval.value_in_minutes`.

members.name: timeBetweenSlots
members.doc:
The number of minutes between the `end` of one slot, and the `start` of the next.
Minimum value is 0, maximum value is 120.

description: Describes how to calculate the specific slots that are available for booking.

members.name: splitInterval
members.doc: Specify how to split the schedule slots in intervals of minutes.

description: Availability policy applied to all site schedules.

members.name: periods
members.doc: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

description: Business schedule. Regular and exceptional time periods when the business is open or the service is available.

members.name: _id
members.doc: External calendar ID.

members.name: name
members.doc:
Display name of the external calendar.
For example, "Primary" or "Birthdays".

members.name: _id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the account owner in the video conferencing service.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc:
Conference type.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER"` API-generated online meeting.
- `"CUSTOM"` User-defined meeting.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: localDateTime
members.doc: An object containing the local date and time for the business's time zone.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
The time zone. Optional. Derived from the schedule's time zone.
In case this field is associated with recurring session, this field is empty.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
UTC date-time in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Coordinated_Universal_Time_(UTC)) format. If a time zone offset is specified, the time is converted to UTC. For example, if you specify  `new Date('2021-01-06T16:00:00.000-07:00')`, the stored value will be `"2021-01-06T23:00:00.000Z"`.
Required if `localDateTime` is not specified.
If `localDateTime` is specified, `timestamp` is calculated as `localDateTime`, using the business's time zone.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conferencing provider ID

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address for the external calendar account.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password for the external calendar account.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: ID of the external calendar provider. Find this with the [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) function.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: ID of the schedule to connect with the external calendar account.

members.name: connection
members.doc: Established connection details.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: ID of the external calendar provider. Find this with the [`listProviders()`](#list-providers) function.

members.name: redirectUrl
members.doc:
URL to redirect the user to after they authorize access to the external calendar account.

If the connection is successfully established, the user is redirected to this URL with a query parameter `connectionId` containing the new connection ID.
If the attempt to connect fails, the user is redirected to this URL with a query parameter `error` containing the error type.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: ID of the schedule to connect with the external calendar account.

members.name: oauthUrl
members.doc: URL of the external calendar authorization page to redirect the user to.

members.name: _id
members.doc: External calendar connection ID.

members.name: appId
members.doc: ID of the Wix App the external calendar connection belongs to.

members.name: calendarType
members.doc: External calendar type.

members.name: errorReason
members.doc:
Reason for the error, if `status` is `ERROR`.

+ `TOKEN_REVOKED`: External calendar access token revoked.
+ `EXTERNAL_CALENDAR_CREATION_FAILED`: External calendar creation failed.
+ `EXTERNAL_CALENDAR_DELETED`: External calendar was deleted.

members.name: externalAccountEmail
members.doc: Email address associated with the external calendar account. Empty until sync is completed successfully.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: ID of the external calendar provider.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: ID of the schedule connected to the external calendar.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Connection status.

+ `CONNECTED`: A connection has been established with the external calendar.
+ `SYNC_IN_PROGRESS`: A sync is in progress.
+ `SYNCED`: External calendar sync complete.
+ `DISCONNECTED`: External calendar has been disconnected.
+ `ERROR`: An error occurred when syncing with the external calendar.

members.name: syncConfig
members.doc:
Sync configuration. Contains settings for enabling, configuring, or disabling functionality, including:

+ Importing events from one or more specified calendars in the connected external calendar account.
+ Exporting events from the Wix site's calendar to an external calendar.

members.name: userId
members.doc: ID of the Wix user the external calendar connection belongs to.

members.name: listEventFromCalendars
members.doc:
Configuration for importing events from external calendars.
If enabled, use the [`listEvents()`](#list-events) function to retrieve a list of events from external calendars.

members.name: syncToCalendar
members.doc: Configuration for exporting calendars from the Wix site's calendar to a connected external calendar.

members.name: calendars
members.doc:
Import events from a list of specified external calendars.

**Note**: The list can include the primary calendar.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether to enable importing events from external calendars through this connection.

members.name: primaryCalendar
members.doc:
Import events only from the primary external calendar. Enable this by passing an empty object.

**Note**: Not all external calendar providers designate a primary calendar.

members.name: calendars
members.doc:
Import events from a list of specified external calendars.

**Note**: The list can include the primary calendar.

members.name: primaryCalendar
members.doc:
Import events only from the primary external calendar. Enable this by passing an empty object.

**Note**: Not all external calendar providers designate a primary calendar.

members.name: dedicatedCalendar
members.doc: Sync to a dedicated external calendar. Enable this by passing an empty object.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether to enable exporting events to an external calendars through this connection.

members.name: primaryCalendar
members.doc: Sync to the primary external calendar. Enable this by passing an empty object.

members.name: dedicatedCalendar
members.doc: Sync to a dedicated external calendar. Enable this by passing an empty object.

members.name: primaryCalendar
members.doc: Sync to the primary external calendar. Enable this by passing an empty object.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of events to load.
Max: `1000`

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: connectionId
members.doc: ID of the external calendar connection to disconnect.

members.name: connection
members.doc: Updated connection details.

members.name: allDay
members.doc:
Whether the event is an all-day event.

Default: `false`

members.name: calendarName
members.doc:
Display name of the external calendar.
For example, "Primary" or "Birthdays".

members.name: calendarType
members.doc: External calendar type.

members.name: end
members.doc: End date and time of the event (exclusive), formatted according to [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: ID of the schedule connected to the external calendar the event belongs to.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc:
ID of the Wix user the schedule belongs to.
For example, the ID of the staff member (resource) who owns the schedule.

members.name: scheduleOwnerName
members.doc:
Name of the Wix user the schedule belongs to.
For example, the name of the staff member (resource) who owns the schedule.

members.name: start
members.doc: Start date and time of the event (inclusive), formatted according to [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

members.name: title
members.doc: Event title.

description: An external calendar event.

members.name: calendarType
members.doc: The external calendar type (e.g. Google Calendar, iCal, etc).

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: repetition
members.doc: The frequency of the recurrence in weeks. i.e. when this value is 4, the interval occurs every 4 weeks. Optional. The default is 1. minimum: 1, maximum: 52.

members.name: connectionId
members.doc: ID of the connection to retrieve.

members.name: connection
members.doc: Retrieved external calendar connection.

members.name: daysOfWeek
members.doc: The day the interval accrue. Optional. The default is the day of the recurring interval's start time.

members.name: duration
members.doc: The duration of the interval in minutes. Required. Part of the session end time calculation. minimum: 1, maximum: 86400.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: The hour of the day the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval start time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 23.

members.name: minuteOfHour
members.doc: The minutes of hour the interval accrue. must be consistent with the Interval end time. Options. The default is 0. minimum: 0, maximum: 59.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets this schedule's availability for the duration of the linked schedule's sessions.  Default is `"BUSY"`.
<!--ONLY:REST-->
If set to `"BUSY"`, this schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
If set to `"FREE"`, this schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:REST-->

<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"FREE"` This schedule can have available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
- `"BUSY"` This schedule cannot have any available slots during the linked schedule's sessions.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: connectionId
members.doc: ID of the external calendar connection to list calendars for.

members.name: calendars
members.doc: List of calendars belonging to the external calendar account.

members.name: partialFailure
members.doc:
Whether to return a partial list of connections if details can't be retrieved for some connections.

Default: `false`

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc:
Schedule IDs to filter by. If provided, only connections between external calendars and the specified schedules is returned.

Default: Returns all connections.

members.name: partialFailure
members.doc:
Whether to return a partial list of connections if details can't be retrieved for some connections.

Default: `false`

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc:
Schedule IDs to filter by. If provided, only connections between external calendars and the specified schedules is returned.

Default: Returns all connections.

members.name: connections
members.doc: List of external calendar connections.

members.name: failedProviderIds
members.doc: List of provider IDs for connections for which retrieval failed. Returned only if `partialFailure` parameter is `true` in the request.

members.name: allDay
members.doc:
Whether to include only all-day events in the returned list.
If `true`, only all-day events are returned.
If `false`, only events with a specified time are returned.

Default: All events are returned.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Predefined sets of fields to return.
- `NO_PI`: Returns event objects without personal information.
- `OWN_PI`: Returns complete event objects, including personal information.

Default: `NO_PI`

members.name: from
members.doc:
Date and time from which to retrieve events,
formatted according to [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).
Required, unless `cursorPaging.cursor` is provided.

Events which start before the `from` time and end after it are included in the returned list.

members.name: partialFailure
members.doc:
Whether to return a partial list of events if details can't be retrieved for some connections.

Default: `false`

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc:
Schedule IDs to filter by. If provided, the returned list includes only events belonging to external calendars connected to the specified schedules.
Maximum of 100 schedule IDs per request.

members.name: to
members.doc:
Date and time until which to retrieve events,
formatted according to [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).
Required, unless `cursorPaging.cursor` is provided.

Events which start before the `to` time and end after it are included in the returned list.

members.name: userIds
members.doc:
Wix user IDs to filter by. If provided, the returned list includes only events belonging to external calendars connected to schedules belonging to the specified Wix users.
Maximum of 100 Wix user IDs per request.

members.name: allDay
members.doc:
Whether to include only all-day events in the returned list.
If `true`, only all-day events are returned.
If `false`, only events with a specified time are returned.

Default: All events are returned.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Pagination options.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc:
Predefined sets of fields to return.
- `NO_PI`: Returns event objects without personal information.
- `OWN_PI`: Returns complete event objects, including personal information.

Default: `NO_PI`

members.name: from
members.doc:
Date and time from which to retrieve events,
formatted according to [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).
Required, unless `cursorPaging.cursor` is provided.

Events which start before the `from` time and end after it are included in the returned list.

members.name: partialFailure
members.doc:
Whether to return a partial list of events if details can't be retrieved for some connections.

Default: `false`

members.name: scheduleIds
members.doc:
Schedule IDs to filter by. If provided, the returned list includes only events belonging to external calendars connected to the specified schedules.
Maximum of 100 schedule IDs per request.

members.name: to
members.doc:
Date and time until which to retrieve events,
formatted according to [RFC 3339](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).
Required, unless `cursorPaging.cursor` is provided.

Events which start before the `to` time and end after it are included in the returned list.

members.name: userIds
members.doc:
Wix user IDs to filter by. If provided, the returned list includes only events belonging to external calendars connected to schedules belonging to the specified Wix users.
Maximum of 100 Wix user IDs per request.

members.name: events
members.doc: List of external calendar events matching the filters.

members.name: failedProviderIds
members.doc: List of provider IDs for connections for which retrieval of events failed. Returned only if `partialFailure` parameter is `true` in the request.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata.

members.name: providers
members.doc:
Retrieves a list of the external calendar providers for which the site supports integration.

The list of external calendar providers includes:

+ External calendar providers that are supported by default, such as Google, Apple, and Microsoft.
+ External calenders for which the site owner has enabled integration by installing an app.

For each external calendar provider, the list contains information about supported connection methods and features.
For each provider, check `features.connectMethods` to find out whether to use [`connectByCredentials()`](#connect-by-credentials) or [`connectByOAuth()`](#connect-by-o-auth) to establish a connection.

members.name: dayOfMonth
members.doc: Day of the month, from 1-31.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: Hour of the day in 24-hour format, from 0-23.

members.name: minutesOfHour
members.doc: Minute, from 0-59.

members.name: monthOfYear
members.doc: Month number, from 1-12.

members.name: year
members.doc: Year. 4-digit format.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when locationType is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: businessLocation
members.doc:
Valid when `locationType` is `OWNER_BUSINESS`. Defaults to the business's location.

`businessSchedule` is not supported by Wix Bookings

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when locationType is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`. Might be used when locationType is `"CUSTOM"` in case the owner sets a custom address for the session which is different from the default.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.
One of:
- `"OWNER_BUSINESS"` The business address as set in the sites general settings.
- `"OWNER_CUSTOM"` The address as set when creating the service.
- `"CUSTOM"` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: city
members.doc: City name.

members.name: country
members.doc: 2-letter country code in an [ISO-3166 alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: Postal or zip code.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

description: Address Geolocation

members.name: _id
members.doc: Location ID.

members.name: address
members.doc: Address.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated.
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-business-tools-v2/locations/archivelocation)
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: description
members.doc: Location description.

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address.

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number.

members.name: locationType
members.doc: Location type. **Note:** Currently not supported.

members.name: name
members.doc: Location name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status. Defaults to `ACTIVE`.
__Note:__ [Archiving a location](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-business-tools-v2/locations/archivelocation)
doesn't affect the location's status. `INACTIVE` is currently not supported.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Timezone in `America/New_York` format.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

description: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Participant ID. Currently represents the booking.id.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc:
Approval status for the participant.
<!-- Commented out untill updateParticipant is exposed Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant()` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.-->
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"PENDING"` Pending business approval.
- `"APPROVED"` Approved by the business.
- `"DECLINED"` Declined by the business.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: message
members.doc: Custom message to send to the participants about the changes to the booking.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc:
Whether to send the message about the changes to the customer.

Default: `false`

members.name: amount
members.doc: Required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: Amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the external calendar provider.

members.name: calendarType
members.doc: External calendar provider type.

members.name: features
members.doc: Features the external calendar provider supports.

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the external calendar provider.

members.name: connectMethods
members.doc:
Supported connection methods.

For providers supporting `OAUTH`, connect with the [`connectByOAuth()`](#connect-by-o-auth) function.
For providers supporting `CREDENTIALS`, connect with the [`connectByCredentials()`](#connect-by-credentials) function.

members.name: listEventFromCalendars
members.doc:
Whether events can be imported from external calendars to the Wix calendar.

+ `NOT_SUPPORTED`: Importing events from the external calendar is not supported.
+ `PRIMARY_CALENDAR_ONLY`: Events can be imported only from an external calendar designated as primary.
+ `SPECIFIC_CALENDARS`: Events can be imported from specific external calendars. Use [`listCalendars()`](#list-calendars) to get a list of calendars for a connected external calendar account.

members.name: syncToCalendar
members.doc:
Whether Wix calendar sessions can be exported to the external calendar.

+ `NOT_SUPPORTED`: Exporting events to an external calendar is not supported.
+ `PRIMARY_CALENDAR_ONLY`: Events can only be exported only to an external calendar designated as primary.
+ `SPECIFIC_CALENDARS`: Events can be exported to specific external calendars. Use [`listCalendars()`](#list-calendars) to get a list of calendars for a connected external calendar account.
+ `DEDICATED_CALENDAR`: Events can be exported to a newly created, dedicated external calendar in the connected external calendar account.

members.name: updateSyncConfig
members.doc:
Whether the sync configuration can be updated after a connection is established.

If `true`, you can update the sync configuration using the [`UpdateSyncConfig()`](#update-sync-config) function.

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc:
Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.
When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: priceText
members.doc:
Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.
When present in an update request, the `default_varied_price` is ignored to support backward compatibility.

members.name: _id
members.doc: The recurring interval identifier.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc: Specifies the list of linked schedules and the way this link affects the corresponding schedules' availability. Can be calculated from the schedule or overridden on the recurring interval.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the recurring interval. Optional. Empty value indicates that there is no end time.

members.name: frequency
members.doc: The frequency of the interval. Optional. The default is frequency with the default repetition.

members.name: interval
members.doc: The interval rules. The day, hour and minutes the interval is recurring.

members.name: intervalType
members.doc:
The type of recurring interval.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"UNDEFINED"` The default value. Sessions for this interval will be of type EVENT.
- `"EVENT"` A recurring interval of events.
- `"WORKING_HOURS"` A recurring interval for availability.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the recurring interval. Required.

members.name: newRecurringSessions
members.doc: New schedule's recurring session list.

members.name: oldRecurringSessions
members.doc: Old schedule's recurring session list.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: availability
members.doc:
An object describing how to calculate the schedule's availability.
An empty object indicates that the schedule is not available for booking.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc: A conference created for the schedule. This is used when a participant is added to a schedule.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the schedule's sessions.
Must be at most `1` for schedule whose availability is affected by another schedule. E.g, appointment schedules of the Wix Bookings app.

members.name: conferenceProvider
members.doc: Conferencing Provider. A schedule with a conferencing provider will use to provider information to create a conference on the provider's system when a session is created on the schedule or on one of its linked schedule's.

members.name: created
members.doc: Schedule creation date.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc: Fields which were inherited from the Business Info page under Settings in the Dashboard.

members.name: intervals
members.doc:
Specifies the intervals for the sessions calculation. Optional. e.g. when creating class service you can add
pattern for recurring intervals, these intervals can be returned as schedule's sessions or available slots if
there are no other availability calculation constraints and the capacity is bigger then the current total number of sessions' participants.

members.name: location
members.doc: Default location for the schedule's sessions.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
Participants currently registered to sessions in this schedule.
Participants who are registered in the schedule are automatically registered to any session that is created for the schedule.

members.name: rate
members.doc: Price options offered when booking this schedule's slots. Default is no rate.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the schedule's owner entity. This may be a resource ID or a service ID.

members.name: status
members.doc: Schedule status.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for grouping schedules. These tags are the default tags for the schedule's sessions.
The Wix Bookings app uses the following predefined tags to set schedule type: `"INDIVIDUAL"`, `"GROUP"`, and `"COURSE"`. Once the schedule type is set using these tags, you cannot update it. In addition to the app's tags, you can create and update your own tags.

members.name: title
members.doc: Default title for the schedule's sessions. Maximum length: 6000 characters.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc: Number of participants registered to sessions in this schedule, calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: updated
members.doc: Schedule last update date.

members.name: version
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: migrationEvent
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: multipleSessionsCreated
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: notifyParticipants
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about changed sessions. deprecated, use participant_notification

members.name: scheduleUnassignedFromUser
members.doc: Inspect `schedule.scheduleOwnerUserId` on `scheduleUpdated` instead.

members.name: siteProperties
members.doc: site properties. Optional. Given in create schedule notification.

members.name: migrationEvent
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: multipleSessionsCreated
members.doc: supported only for schedule migration apis.

members.name: scheduleUnassignedFromUser
members.doc: Inspect `schedule.scheduleOwnerUserId` on `scheduleUpdated` instead.

members.name: schedule
members.doc: The schedule that was unassigned from the user.

members.name: userId
members.doc: The Wix user id.

description: Schedule unassigned from user.

members.name: newSchedule
members.doc: The new schedule after the update.

members.name: oldSchedule
members.doc: The old schedule before the update.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: recurringSessions
members.doc:
Recurring sessions updated event. If this field is given, the reason for the schedule updated event was
updating at least one of the given schedule's recurring sessions.
This event is triggered by create/update/delete recurring session apis.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether this notification was created as a result of an anonymization request, such as GDPR.
An anonymized participant will have the following details:
name = "deleted"
phone = "deleted"
email = "deleted@deleted.com"

members.name: _id
members.doc: Session ID.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc:
An object specifying a list of schedules and the way each schedule's availability is affected by the session. For example, the schedule of an instructor is affected by sessions of the class that they instruct.
The array is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden even if the session is a recurring session.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc:
A conference created for the session according to the details set in the schedule's conference provider information.
If the session is a recurring session, this field is inherited from the schedule.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the session. Defaults to the schedule capacity.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: end
members.doc:
An object specifying the end date and time of the session. The `end` time must be after the `start` time and be same type as `start`.
If the session is a recurring session, `end` must contain a `localDateTime`.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc:
A list of properties for which values were inherited from the schedule.
This does not include participants that were inherited from the schedule.

members.name: instanceOfRecurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) if the session is an instance of a recurrence pattern.
Empty when the session is not an instance of a recurrence rule, or if the session defines a recurrence pattern, and `recurrence` is not empty.

members.name: location
members.doc:
An object describing the location where the session takes place.
Defaults to the schedule location.
For single sessions, `session.location.businessLocation` can only be provided for locations that are defined in the schedule using `schedule.location` or `schedule.availability.locations`.

members.name: notes
members.doc:
Additional information about the session.
Notes are not supported for recurring sessions.

members.name: originalStart
members.doc: Original start date and time of the session in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Coordinated_Universal_Time_(UTC)) format.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
List of participants booked for the session.
The list includes participants who have registered for this specific session, and participants who have registered for a schedule that includes this session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: rate
members.doc:
The price options offered for the session.  Defaults to the schedule rate.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: recurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) for a recurring session, as defined in [iCalendar RFC 5545](https://icalendar.org/iCalendar-RFC-5545/3-3-10-recurrence-rule.html).
If the session is an instance of a recurrence pattern, the `instanceOfRecurrence` property will be contain the recurrence rule and this property will be empty.
The RRULE defines a rule for repeating a session.
Supported parameters are:

|Keyword|Description|Supported values|
|--|--|---|
|`FREQ`|The frequency at which the session is recurs. Required.|`WEEKLY`|
|`INTERVAL`|How often, in terms of `FREQ`, the session recurs. Default is 1. Optional.|
|`UNTIL`|The UTC end date and time of the recurrence. Optional.|
|`BYDAY`|Day of the week when the event should recur. Required.|One of: `MO`, `TU`, `WE`, `TH`, `FR`, `SA`, `SU`|


For example, a session that repeats every second week on a Monday until January 7, 2022 at 8 AM:
`"FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20220107T080000Z"`

<!--ORIGINAL COMMENTS:
`FREQ`  The frequency with which the session should be repeated (such as DAILY or WEEKLY).
Supported `WEEKLY` value is supported.
INTERVAL  Works together with FREQ to specify how often the session should be repeated. For example, FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2 means once every two weeks. Optional. Default value is 1.
COUNT  The number of times this event should be repeated. Not yet supported.
UNTIL  The UTC date & time until which the session should be repeated. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified, the event repeats forever.
The format is a short ISO date, followed by 'T' and a short time with seconds and without milliseconds, terminated by the UTC designator 'Z'. For example, until Jan. 19th 2018 at 7:00 AM: 'UNTIL=20180119T070000Z'.
BYDAY - The days of the week when the event should be repeated. Currently, only a single day is supported. This parameter is mandatory.
Possible values are: MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU
Note that DTSTART and DTEND lines are not allowed in this field; session start and end times are specified in the start and end fields.
**Example**: FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20200427T070000Z
ORIGINAL COMMENTS-->

members.name: recurringIntervalId
members.doc:
Recurring interval ID. Defined when a session will be a recurring session. read-only. Optional.
For exmaple, when creating a class service  with recurring sessions, you add a recurrence rule to create recurring sessions.
This field is omitted for single sessions or instances of recurring sessions.
Specified when the session was originally generated from a schedule recurring interval.
Deprecated. Use `recurringSessionId`.

members.name: recurringSessionId
members.doc: The ID of the recurring session if this session is an instance of a recurrence. Use this ID to update the recurrence and all of the instances.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: ID of the schedule that the session belongs to.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: ID of the resource or service that the session's schedule belongs to.

members.name: start
members.doc: An object specifying the start date and time of the session. If the session is a recurring session, `start` must contain a `localDateTime`.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Session status.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"CONFIRMED"` Default value.
- `"CANCELLED"` The session was deleted.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for the session.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: timeReservedAfter
members.doc:
Time reserved after the session end time, derived from the schedule availability constraints and the time between slots. Read-only.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Session title.
The value is inherited from the schedule and can be overridden unless the session is a recurring session.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The number of participants booked for the session. Read-only.
Calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Session type.
<!--ONLY:VELO
One of:
- `"EVENT"` Reserved period of time on the schedule. For example, an appointment, class, course, or blocked time. Events are visible in the Dashboard in the Bookings app's [Booking Calendar](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-about-the-wix-bookings-calendar) page.
- `"WORKING_HOURS"` Placeholder for available time on a resources schedule.
<!--END:ONLY:VELO-->

members.name: version
members.doc:
The session version.
Composed by the schedule, session and participants versions.

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: participantNotification
members.doc: Whether to notify participants about the change and an optional custom message

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether this notification was created as a result of an anonymization request, such as GDPR.
An anonymized participant will have the following details:
name = "deleted"
phone = "deleted"
email = "deleted@deleted.com"

members.name: number
members.doc: Incremental version number, which is updated on each change to the session or on changes affecting the session.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The global time zone value.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Additional info about the exception. For example, "We close earlier on New Year's Eve."

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: isClosed
members.doc:
Whether the business is closed (or the service is not available) during the exception.

Default: `true`.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

description: Exception to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

members.name: sameAsDuration
members.doc:
Whether the slot duration is used as the split interval value.
If `same_as_duration` is `true`, the `value_in_minutes` is the sum of the first duration in
`schedule.availabilityConstraints.SlotDurations` field, and `schedule.availabilityConstraints.TimeBetweenSlots` field.

members.name: valueInMinutes
members.doc: Number of minutes between available slots' start times when `same_as_duration` is `false`.

description: The time between available slots' start times. For example, For 5 minute slots, 3:00, 3:05, 3:15 etc. For 1 hour slots, 3:00, 4:00, 5:00 etc.

members.name: apt
members.doc: Apartment number.

members.name: name
members.doc: Street name.

members.name: number
members.doc: Street number.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name
members.doc: Subdivision full name.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time the period ends in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

__Note:__ If `openDay` and `closeDay` specify the same day of the week `closeTime` must be later than `openTime`.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time the period starts in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

description: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available.

members.name: connectionId
members.doc: ID of the external calendar connection to update.

members.name: syncConfig
members.doc: Updated sync configuration details.

members.name: connection
members.doc: Connection with updated sync configuration.

members.name: participantsVersion
members.doc: Participants version number, updated each time the schedule participants are updated.

members.name: scheduleVersion
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.
